TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TimeSpanValidatorAttribute extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttribute

Docs.summary: Declaratively instructs the .NET Framework to perform time validation on a configuration property. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use the TimeSpanValidatorAttribute attribute to decorate a configuration property. This is to instruct the .NET Framework to validate the property using the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> class and pass to it the value of the decorating parameters.
You can apply TimeSpanValidatorAttribute objects to property types only.
## Examples The following example shows how to decorate the properties of a custom <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection> object using the TimeSpanValidatorAttribute attribute.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.configuration.t_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.configuration.t_1_1.cs)]
The following example is an excerpt of the configuration file that contains the custom section used by the previous sample.
``` <configuration xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/.NetConfiguration/v2.0"> <configSections> <section name="custom" type="Microsoft.Samples.AspNet.Configuration.SampleSection, ConfigurationValidatorAttribute" /> </configSections> <custom fileName="NewFile.txt" maxSize="1000" maxAttempts="101" maxUsers="2500" maxIdleTime="00:15:00" /> </configuration> ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use this constructor in the attributed model to ensure that the type of the value assigned to the related property is a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.StringValidatorAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#12](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.configuration.t_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#12](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.configuration.t_0_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include or exclude the integers in the range as defined by <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MinValueString%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MaxValueString%2A>.
Docs.value: if the value must be excluded; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The range is inclusive of the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MinValueString%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MaxValueString%2A> properties. When the ExcludeRange property is `false`, the allowed values are outside the range.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the ExcludeRange property.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.t_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.t_0_1.cs)]
## Remarks This is the absolute maximum value allowed by the .NET Framework. Its value is defined by the <xref:System.TimeSpan> field.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the relative maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is the relative maximum value as set by the user.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the MaxValueString property.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.t_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.t_1_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The selected value represents less than <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MinValue%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the absolute minimum value allowed by the .NET Framework. Its value is defined by the <xref:System.TimeSpan> field.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the relative minimum <xref:System.TimeSpan> value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is the relative minimum value as set by the user.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the MinValueString property.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.t_2_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.t_2_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The selected value represents more than <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidatorAttribute.MaxValue%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the absolute maximum value allowed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The string that contains the maximum allowed value for the time interval.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the TimeSpanMaxValue field.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/f-system.configuration.t_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/f-system.configuration.t_0_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets the absolute minimum value allowed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The string that contains the minimum allowed value for the time interval.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the TimeSpanMinValue field.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#11](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/f-system.configuration.t_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#11](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/f-system.configuration.t_1_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets an instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You use the ValidatorInstance property to perform string validation by calling its <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method.
